page.title: 18Traditions in Horsmonden
page.content: The Romany Horse Fair has been held on the Village Green for about 200 years. Horse dealers & travelling people congregate on the Green to buy & sell horses & ponies. Some local people have objected to their village green being used in this way by those they consider outsiders & in 1983 the site was changed to a meadow in Paddock Wood. The Lamb Sale. Lambert & Foster auction up to 15000 lambs at the sale in the Sports Field each July. Buyers come from all parts of the country. In 1984 the best lambs fetched an average of 45 pounds each. The Village Fete. On a Saturday afternoon in June every year there is a Fete on the Green. Every organisation in the village has a stall of some kind & the proceeds are divided among the organisations.
